page.title: 08PRIMARY LEISURE SURVEY
page.content: A survey of how primary school children spend their leisure time showed that in school the predominant playground games are football,chasing or skipping.Seasonal variations include conkers,hopscotch,marbles and foot cricket although these are not as popular as a few years ago. Most leisure time was spent watching television with only about 20% taking part in clubs outside school.Of these about a half attend Brownies or cub scouts with only a few belonging to other youth organisations. A little over 20% of children asked attended church- mainly Anglican.An increasing number of children have access to a home computer and over 50% have their own television set.Many children now watch video films instead of or as well as regular programmes.
